: Table 1. Search strategy for a scientific assessment of risk to the population of some tortoises listed by CITES as a result of trade {#tbl-SS}

```{r import references, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
files<-list.files(path = paste0(here::here(),"/Scoping_stage"), full.names = TRUE)
labels<-rep(c("lens","WoS"),12)
cites<-CiteSource::read_citations(files = files, cite_labels = labels)
```

```{r dedup citations, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
unique_citations<-CiteSource::dedup_citations(cites)
```

```{r source comparision, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Count number of unique and non-unique citations from different sources and labels. 
n_unique <- CiteSource::count_unique(unique_citations)

#For each unique citation, determine which labels were present
source_comparison_labels <- CiteSource::compare_sources(unique_citations, comp_type = "labels")
# determine sources
source_comparison_sources <- CiteSource::compare_sources(unique_citations)
```

```{r overlaps, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
overlaps<-source_comparison_labels |> 
  dplyr::mutate(both=paste0(label__lens, label__WoS)) |> 
  dplyr::group_by(both) |> 
  dplyr::tally()
```

The search resulted in `r nrow(cites)` records. Of these there were `r overlaps[2,2]` records unique to Lens.org and `r overlaps[1,2]` records unique to WoS. There were `r overlaps[3,2]` records duplicated across databases (@fig-Overlap).

```{r plot source overlap, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.cap="Overlapping records between databases"}
#| label: fig-Overlap
CiteSource::plot_source_overlap_upset(source_comparison_labels, "label")

```

The overlap for each species between databases is shown below (@fig-species)

```{r plot overlap species, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.cap="Overlap between sources for each species"}
#| label: fig-species

#Generate source comparison heatmap
CiteSource::plot_source_overlap_heatmap(source_comparison_sources)
```

The records returned were published between 1871 and 2023 (@fig-year) and published in 1094 different journals. Most records are from the Journal Nature, although 668 records have no journal recorded.

```{r publication year, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.cap="Publication year"}
#| label: fig-year
unique_citations  |>  
  dplyr::group_by(year)  |> 
  dplyr::mutate(year=as.numeric(year)) |> 
  tidyr::drop_na(year) |> 
  dplyr::summarise(count = dplyr::n())  |>   
  ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(year, count)) +
  ggplot2::geom_bar(stat="identity", fill="darkred") +
  ggplot2::xlab("Publication year") + 
  ggplot2::ylab("Unique records")+
  ggthemes::theme_base()+
  ggplot2::theme(axis.text.x = ggplot2::element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1))
```

```{r journals, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE,eval=FALSE, fig.cap="Top 25 Publication sources ", include=FALSE}
#| label: fig-source}

journals<-unique_citations  |>  
  dplyr::group_by(journal)  |> 
  dplyr::summarise(count = dplyr::n())  |>  
  dplyr::mutate(jour=abbreviate(journal)) 

journals[1,1]<-"NA"

journals[2:1084,]|> 
  dplyr::top_n(25, count) |> 
  ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(reorder(journal, count), count)) +
  ggplot2::geom_bar(stat="identity", fill="darkred") +
  ggplot2::xlab("Journal") + 
  ggplot2::ylab("Records")+
  ggthemes::theme_base()+
  ggplot2::coord_flip()

```
